p: The empirical models for predicting diversity in species groups were found to satisfactorily fit the empirical data, with pseudo‐ R² values ranging from 0·23 to 0·96 (Table 1). Chi‐square goodness‐of‐fit tests did not reject the final models. VIF and GVIF, respectively, were all <10, indicating that final models were not strongly affected by multicollinearity (Dormann et al. 2013).
